snippet: A shroud of mystery surrounding the fate of more than 100 English colonists on North Carolina’s coast may finally be lifting, after the re-examination of a 16th-century map.
abstract: British Museum publishes new data related to the mysterious disappearance of more than 100 English colonists from Roanoke Island, North Carolina, in the late 1500s; researchers used imaging technology to re-examine a 16th-century coastal map, revealing markings that indicate the colonists may have resettled further inland.
lead_paragraph: A shroud of mystery surrounding the fate of more than 100 English colonists on North Carolina’s coast may finally be lifting, after the re-examination of a 16th-century map.

headline.seo: Map Markings Offer Clues to Lost Colony
headline.main: Map’s Hidden Marks Illuminate and Deepen Mystery of Lost Colony
headline.print_headline: Map’s Hidden Marks Illuminate and Deepen Mystery of Lost Colony
